adrFormatAddress: 530 1st Ave., New York, NY 10016-6402, USA

originalText.text: At 102 years old, I have a pacemaker and only NYU was willing to do an MRI of my brain.  All went perfectly and every one was super nice and helpful EXCEPT, IT HAS BEEN 2MONTHS AND i still did not get the promised DVD, nor did the doctor who ordered the exam.  For two months we have called (no on answers) without response. No one takes responsibility or seems to know how I can get copies

originalText.text: I've had nothing but terrible experiences with NYU Radiology. This is not the first but it will be the last time I deal with them. I was actually told if I didn't like dealing with them then I should go somewhere else and then hung up on it. They are absolutely the rudest people I've spoken to different people same results. I'm guessing they were raised by wolves because they have zero manners and respect what amazes me is the NYU Hospital/ Radiology has not gotten back to one person who has given a bad review which there are many. It speaks volumes on how they do not care about their patients! NYU Hospital has changed it's not the same anymore they just don't care. Thank you NYU for all the disrespect! I'm currently dealing with Mount Sinai in Manhattan. I have nothing but great results. With everything I do with them including Radiology! Do yourself a favor and don't deal with NYU !

originalText.text: I had a terrible time dealing with nyu's imaging department I was dealing with Hector who was extremely rude and did not explain himself properly when I asked if I could make an appointment at NYU brooklyn. He immediately said I don't make those appointments and transferred me to the wrong number. When I did try to speak to him he spoke over me!! He if he hates dealing with people maybe it's time for a new job . I'm sure no one will be getting back to me so I will be going to another facility not NYU I'm done with NYU he wasted 45 minutes of my time and got nothing accomplished! Thank you NYU.

originalText.text: Horrible experience at this facility there was a 2 hour delay from check in till when I was in a chair. I also had to fast for my exam. Because of a 2 hour commute, I had been fasting since the morning, so a 3 hour fast turned into a 7 hour fast with the delays and commute time.  NYU should figure out how to schedule patients so there isn’t over a 2 hour delay. Ain’t nobody have time for that.

originalText.text: Despite all my doctors being located at NYU Trinity downtown. I reluctantly booked my appointment here on 30th street and walked all the way east to get here, it is really off the beaten track from the train and no good pubic transportation. So now I have arrived and they told me that they are backed up by an hour and neglected to call me! A big thumbs down, and now I realize why I have never switched from  Lenox Hill Radiology, where I have never waited more then 20 minutes. Then they over billed me; I only realized this months later when they sent a $400 refund because they never subtracted the agreed upon discount with my insurance company! Going to a place in network and at the hospital is supposed to be less costly!
